Package scenegraph

Class AbstNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • scenegraph.AbstSceneObject
      • scenegraph.AbstNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ChannelInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstRenderState, AbstSpatial
    public abstract class AbstNode
extends AbstSceneObject
    Base class for all node objects in the scene graph. These can be spatial nodes or render nodes, containing objects which contribute to the 'drawing' on the screen. Drawing does not always mean that actual geometry will be shown. Instead, these objects are also used to control a renderer's internal state machine, e.g. to place light sources, to set the color for triangle faces or to modify the active transformation. A 'hidden' flag is maintained; setting this flag will deactivate the respective object in such a way that it will not have any effect on the rendering process (e.g. geometric objects will not be drawn).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ursula Derichs

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstNode

        public AbstNode​(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor sets translation vector to (0, 0, 0), scale to (1, 1, 1) and rotation matrix to identity matrix (this means no translation, no scaling and no rotation of original object). Local and global transformation matrices are set to the Identity. It also creates channels to all spatial attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - object's name

      • AbstNode

        public AbstNode​(AbstNode obj)
        Copy Constructor.
        Parameters:
        obj - object to be copied

      • AbstNode

        public AbstNode()
        Default Constructor assigns a default name for the object

      • updateWorldTransform

        public void updateWorldTransform​(Mat4 world)
        The transformation matrices are only relevant for spatial nodes. The base class method here is only a dummy method, which is overridden in AbtSpatial.
        Parameters:
        world - world transformation matrix

      • updateTransform

        public void updateTransform()

      • draw

        public boolean draw​(AbstRenderer renderer)
        Passes this object to the renderer (if it is not hidden). In detail: 1) Requests the renderer to calculate the new transformation matrix. The transformation matrix is the multiplication result of the transformation matrix of the surrounding group within the scenegraph (this matrix lays on top of the stack) and the local transformation matrix. 2) Requests the renderer to draw the object. 3) Finally requests the renderer to throw away again the transformation matrix.
        Parameters:
        renderer - the renderer for the scene
        Returns:
        true

      • onDraw

        public abstract void onDraw​(AbstRenderer renderer)
        needs to be overridden in derived classes, as objects have different rendering needs.
        Parameters:
        renderer -

      • searchNode

        public AbstNode searchNode​(java.lang.String id)
        Checks if the node matches the specified id.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the node to be searched, can be specified as a regular expression
        Returns:
        this, if the id matches, otherwise null
